summary: Installing an older version of @temporalio/worker pulls in the latest minor version of @temporalio/common due to caret (^) version constraints, causing breaking changes. Version 1.3.0 fails when @temporalio/common 1.4.0 unexports the errorMessage function.
userImpact: Users installing specific older versions of the SDK encounter runtime errors due to incompatible dependency versions being automatically pulled in.
rootCause: Package dependencies use caret (^) version constraints allowing minor version updates, but breaking changes were introduced in minor releases without proper version pinning.
proposedFix: Pin exact versions of Temporal SDK dependencies across all packages instead of using caret constraints.
resolutionDetails: Fixed in version 1.3.1 by switching to tilde (~) constraints for patch-only updates. Issue remained in 1.4.x versions which continued using caret constraints.
keyQuote: Since @temporalio/workflow depends on "@temporalio/common": "^1.3.0" instead of "@temporalio/common": "1.3.0", it installs the latest minor version.
